DOC.brief_title: Carpel Tunnel Syndrome Physical Therapy Modalities
DOC.detailed_description: Carpal tunnel syndrome ( CTS ) one common peripheral nerve entrapment disorder upper limb . CTS common pregnancy especially third trimester well , significant percentage female postnatal may still complaints least 3 year postnatal . Purpose : To compare effect pulse magnetic field ( PEMF ) versus ultrasound ( US ) treat patient CTS . Forty postnatal female patient idiopathic CTS assign randomly two equal group . One group receive PEMF nerve tendon gliding exercise wrist 3 time week 4 week . The group receive US plus exercise . Pain level , sensory motor distal latency median nerve ( MSDL MMDL ) , sensory motor conduction velocity median nerve ( MSCV MMCV ) , functional status scale hand grip strength assess pre post treatment
DOC.criteria: Mild moderate CTS Positive electro diagnostic finding : prolonged median motor distal latency ( MMDL ) 4 m , 6ms . Prolonged median sensory distal latency 3.5 m . Positive Phalen Tinel test . Subjects score pain intensity 5 visual analogue scale ( VAS ) . severe case delay motor distal latency > 6ms .
